raw_text: A Feature-based TAG (Vijay-Shanker and Joshi,1988) consists of a set of (auxiliary or initial) elementary trees and of two tree-composition operations: substitution and ad junction
clean_text: A Feature-based TAG (Vijay-Shanker and Joshi,1988) consists of a set of (auxiliary or initial) elementary trees and of two tree-composition operations: substitution and adjunction.

raw_text: A Feature-based TAG (FTAG, (Vijay-Shanker and Joshi, 1988)) consists of a set of (auxiliary or initial) elementary trees and of two tree composition operations: substitution and ad junction
clean_text: A Feature-based TAG (FTAG, (Vijay-Shanker and Joshi, 1988)) consists of a set of (auxiliary or initial) elementary trees and of two tree composition operations: substitution and adjunction.

raw_text: They arise from top-bottom feature identifications parallel to the unifications performed in FTAG (Vijay-Shanker and Joshi, 1988) and from identifications of global features
clean_text: They arise from top-bottom feature identifications parallel to the unifications performed in FTAG (Vijay-Shanker and Joshi, 1988) and from identifications of global features.

raw_text: A Feature based TAG (FTAG, (Vijay-Shanker and Joshi,1988)) consists of a set of (auxiliary or initial) elementary trees and of two tree composition operations: substitution and ad junction
clean_text: A Feature based TAG (FTAG, (Vijay-Shanker and Joshi,1988)) consists of a set of (auxiliary or initial) elementary trees and of two tree composition operations: substitution and adjunction.

raw_text: 1For more details on FTAG see [Vijay-Shanker and Joshi, 1988]
The equations of top and bottom features linked to specific node positions in the elementary trees are parallel to the syntactic unifications in FTAG (Vijay-Shanker and Joshi, 1988)
clean_text: The equations of top and bottom features linked to specific node positions in the elementary trees are parallel to the syntactic unifications in FTAG (Vijay-Shanker and Joshi, 1988).
